channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2024040452
item.description:
Report E-2024040452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: SEPULPA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor a due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail, impacted absorbents, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024040403
item.description:
Report X-2024040403

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-16T18:13:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-30
  • City: BROKEN ARROW
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was placed on a cart with other closure hazmats. After the sort when putting the hazmats away, I discovered this box that looked previously wet. No indication that it's a hazmat other than the corrosive sign on the back of the box. After further research I discovered this is a hazardous material. I immediately separated this from other hazmats and placed into a hazardous material tote. DescribePack: The cap failed, loose due to abrasion. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately placed upright and into a hazardous material tote.
